User Story: As Katie or Hannah, I want the application to have suitable authorisation and security measures in place, to ensure we are meeting our legal and internal security requirements for employee data.
Acceptance Criteria: Application to require all users to be registered in order to access any routes or functionality.
Action: Attempt to access /dashboard, /settings or a /profile/id when not logged in.
Expected Outcome: The page redirects to the /login page if no valid token is detected.

User Story: As Katie or Hannah, I want the application to have suitable authorisation and security measures in place, to ensure we are meeting our legal and internal security requirements for employee data.
Acceptance Criteria: Application to have rules around password strength to ensure strong passwords for all users
Action: Attempt to change password to something that does not meet validation conditions (e.g. “password”)
Expected Outcome: An error message displays before an API request is even attempted, saying that that the password does not meet the strength requirements

User Story: As Katie or Hannah, I want the application to have suitable authorisation and security measures in place, to ensure we are meeting our legal and internal security requirements for employee data.
Acceptance Criteria: Functionality to be linked to user role, with the application using authorisation to ensure only suitable features/data is available
Action: Navigate to /settings across a number of user roles
Expected Outcome: Admin users see “Manage users” and “Release awards” in Team Settings. Senior Manager users see just “Release awards”. Other users don’t see Team Settings at all on this page.

Acceptance Criteria: Application is developed using a secure tech stack and architecture
Action: This would need to be tested by an experienced penetration tester. For the purposes of this assignment this test is not within scope, but this would be necessary for a professional setting.

User Story: As a user, I want to nominate my colleagues for team or company awards, to ensure that management recognise and reward their efforts.
Acceptance Criteria: When submitting a nomination from the dashboard, users can select a business services employee from a drop-down list
Action: Covered in FE-UT-41

User Story: As a user, I want to give recognition to Nate, so that his efforts and achievements are acknowledged and celebrated by others.
Acceptance Criteria: Users can post a recognition card from the dashboard (business services users only), or from an employee’s profile (all users)
Action: On the Dashboard, users can see a “Send recognition” button. Clicking button this displays a popup form with the required fields for their recognition.
Expected Outcome:
- User sees the “Send recognition” button on Dashboard
- Clicking button displays a popup form

Expected Outcome: A list Full Users from Business Services is displayed to select from.

Expected Outcome: A validation message will display and the form will not be submitted while this field is empty.

User Story: NEW: As a user, I want to be able to log in to use the service
Acceptance Criteria: A user will be able to supply email and password and be able to use the service for 7 days, after receiving a JWT
Action: Enter valid email and password credentials into /login.
Expected Outcome: The page redirects to the Dashboard, and my name is displayed in the welcome message.

User Story: NEW: As a user, I want to be able to log in to use the service

Action: Enter valid email and password credentials into /login.
Expected Outcome: The page redirects to the Dashboard, and my name is displayed in the welcome message.

User Story: NEW: As admin I want to ensure people without valid logins are unable to access the platform
Acceptance Criteria: A user without a valid email and password will be unable to access the service
Action: Enter invalid email and/or password credentials into /login.
Expected Outcome: An error message is displayed in the top-right hand corner and the page does not refresh or redirect.

User Story: NEW: As admin I want to ensure invalid nominations are prevented
Acceptance Criteria: Validation is applied against nominations
Action: Attempt to post a nomination with a required field missing (all fields required)
Expected Outcome: No POST request attempted, a validation popup will display telling the user to complete the field before the nomination can be submitted.

Expected Outcome: No POST request attempted, a validation popup will display telling the user to complete the field before the nomination can be submitted.

User Story: As a business services user, I want to see recognition card posts for all employees, so that I can see the efforts my peers are making and add my support.
Acceptance Criteria: Users have a feed that displays all recognition card posts, with the most recent cards at the top of the feed
Action: Navigate to /dashboard
Expected Outcome: User sees a feed of recognition cards posts, sorted by date with most recent date at top.

Acceptance Criteria: Users can add a comment or reaction to recognition cards
Action:
Navigate to /dashboard, click the comment button on a card.

Reaction feature not implemented, out of scope.
Expected Outcome: User sees a comment button on cards. Clicking on button displays a pop-up to enter and submit their comment.

User Story: As a business services user, I want to see recognition card posts for all employees, so that I can see the efforts my peers are making and add my support.

Action:
Navigate to /dashboard, click the comment button on a card.
Reaction feature not implemented, out of scope.
Expected Outcome: User sees a comment button on cards. Clicking on button displays a pop-up to enter and submit their comment.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to manage the access of application users and their user role, to ensure that all team members have the appropriate access to the application.
Acceptance Criteria: Admin users can add or remove users
Action:
Admin users navigate to /settings and click on “Manage users”.
- Click on “Add user” button
- Click on the Delete icon on an existing user
Expected Outcome:
Only Admin users can see the “Manage users” button in /settings.
- Clicking on “Add user” brings up a form to enter details for new user, that when complete will add the new user.
- Clicking on the Delete icon brings up a confirmation popup, and selecting will delete the user and refresh the screen.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to manage the access of application users and their user role, to ensure that all team members have the appropriate access to the application.
Acceptance Criteria: Admin users can add or remove users
Action:
- Admin users navigate to /settings and click on “Manage users”.
- Click on “Add user” button
- Click on the Delete icon on an existing user
Expected Outcome:
- Only Admin users can see the “Manage users” button in /settings.
- Clicking on “Add user” brings up a form to enter details for new user, that when complete will add the new user.
- Clicking on the Delete icon brings up a confirmation popup, and selecting will delete the user and refresh the screen.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to manage the access of application users and their user role, to ensure that all team members have the appropriate access to the application.
Acceptance Criteria: Admin users can specify the user role of each user
Action: Click on “Add user” button (for new user) or the Edit button (for an existing user). Three checkboxes are available for different user permissions.
Expected Outcome: When selecting user permission checkboxes, this adds/edits the user record with the defined permissions.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to manage the access of application users and their user role, to ensure that all team members have the appropriate access to the application.
Acceptance Criteria: Admin users can specify a manager-employee relationship
Action: Click on “Add user” button (for new user) or the Edit button (for an existing user). Select the “Line manager” drop-down.
Expected Outcome: The “Line manager” drop-down displays the names of users who have isLineManager set to True. Selecting a name and saving the user will write the line manager’s user ID to the user’s record.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to delete recognition cards or comments on card posts, to ensure any content that is inappropriate in a workplace setting does not remain.
Acceptance Criteria: Admin users can delete recognition card posts or comments on these posts
Action: Click on the Delete icon on a card or comment on the Dashboard.
Expected Outcome: When Delete icon is clicked and the confirm button selected, the card/comment is deleted and page is refreshed. Non-admin users won’t see the delete button.

User Story: As Katie, I want to be able to delete recognition cards or comments on card posts, to ensure any content that is inappropriate in a workplace setting does not remain.
Acceptance Criteria: A confirmation message is displayed when this occurs
Action: Clicking “Confirm delete” after clicking the Delete button on a card or comment.
Expected Outcome: A confirmation message is displayed in the top right-hand corner of the screen for 3 seconds before the page is refreshed.

Multiple values per nomination not implemented, only can select one.
Click “Send recognition” and select from “Value” dropdown
Expected Outcome: One of the 6 configured values needs to be selected from when submitting recognition

User Story: As Nate, I want to have an editable profile page on the application, so that I can engage with my colleagues and easily see recognition posts and awards for myself and others.
Acceptance Criteria: Users can upload a profile photo and edit their bio on their profile page
Action: User photo upload out of scope. Users can update their bio from Settings / Edit tagline.
Expected Outcome: Changes submitted in “Edit tagline” will show on the user’s profile.

User Story: As Nate, I want to have an editable profile page on the application, so that I can engage with my colleagues and easily see recognition posts and awards for myself and others.
Acceptance Criteria: Profile pages show any recognition posts and awards for that employee, along with a button to post recognition for them
Action: Navigate to another employee’s profile
Expected Outcome: Any instant thanks/released awards are displayed on their profile, along with a “Send recognition” button

User Story: As Nate, I want to have an editable profile page on the application, so that I can engage with my colleagues and easily see recognition posts and awards for myself and others.
Acceptance Criteria: Users can add the URL of their profile page to email signatures, to make it easier for others in the organisation to give them recognition
Action: Copy the URL of your own profile into a link outside of the application for another user to click.
Expected Outcome: Another person clicking on this link will take them to your profile, when they are logged in. If they are not logged in, they will need to log in first.
